BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JOHN S AND JAMES L KNIGHT FOUNDATION

SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: KNIGHT CITY CHALLENGE:IN SUPPORT OF THE KNIGHT'S COMMUNITIES, THE KNIGHT CITIES CHALLENGE SURFACES AND SUPPORTS THE MOST INNOVATIVE AND PROMISING PROJECTS THAT WORK TOWARDS ONE OR MORE OF THREE KEY FACTORS IN CITY SUCCESS; ATTRACTING AND RETAINING TALENT, EXPANDING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY AND SUPPORTING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT. THE CHALLENGE FUNDS THE PROJECTS, RESEARCHES THEIR IMPACT, DISSEMINATES ANY LEARNING DEVELOPED FROM THE PROJECTS AND NETWORKS CHALLENGE GRANTEES WITH EACH OTHER, AS WELL AS KNIGHT STAFF AND FIELD AND CIVIC LEADERS.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: MEDIA LEARNING SEMINAR:KNIGHT FOUNDATION'S MEDIA LEARNING SEMINAR CONFERENCE BRINGS TOGETHER LEADERS AND FUNDERS FROM ACROSS THE COUNTRY TO DISCUSS WAYS TO PROMOTE MORE INFORMED AND ENGAGED COMMUNITIES.THE 2016 CONFERENCE SESSIONS INCLUDED:CHANGING MEDIA INDUSTRY - AND WHAT THAT MEANS FOR CITIES AND COMMUNITIES; CLIMATE CHANGE - HOW COMMUNITIES FROM MIAMI TO ALASKA ARE RESPONDING; FUTURE TECH TRENDS - WHAT FOUNDATIONS AND CIVIC LEADERS CAN DO TO BOTH PREPARE FOR THEIR EFFECTS AND USE THEM TO THEIR BEST ADVANTAGE.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: KNIGHT NEWS CHALLENGE:ACCESS TO QUALITY NEWS AND INFORMATION PLAYS A VITAL ROLE IN EDUCATING A COMMUNITY. INCREASINGLY, THIS INFORMATION IS DISCOVERED, ANALYZED AND DELIVERED USING DIGITAL AND WEB-BASED TOOLS. THE FOUNDATION USES THE NEWS CHALLENGE TO PROMOTE INNOVATIVE DIGITAL BASED SOLUTIONS TO IMPROVE PEOPLE'S ABILITY TO ACCESS AND INTERACT WITH NEWS, INFORMATION AND EACH OTHER SO THAT THEY CAN MAKE BETTER DECISIONS ABOUT THEIR LIVES AND COMMUNITIES. THE NEWS CHALLENGE PROVIDES GRANTEES WITH RESOURCES INCLUDING TECHNICAL, DESIGN AND BUSINESS ADVISORS AND PROMOTIONAL SUPPORT, AND BRINGS THEM INTO CONTACT WITH ONE ANOTHER, OTHER KNIGHT GRANTEES AND OTHER FIELD LEADERS.THE FOUNDATION CONDUCTED ONE NEWS CHALLENGE IN 2016, WHICH FOCUSED ON LIBRARIES SERVING 21ST CENTURY INFORMATION NEEDS.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: NATIONAL PUBLIC RADIO:THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS NATIONAL PUBLIC RADIO'S PURSUIT OF JOURNALISTIC EXCELLENCE IN THE DIGITAL AGE. THE QUALITY JOURNALISM PRODUCED BY NPR CONTRIBUTES TO INFORMED AND ENGAGED COMMUNITIES, AND KNIGHT SUPPORT HELPS IT BE DISSEMINATED ON NEW PLATFORMS FOR GREATER REACH.

ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.FormAndInfoAndMaterialsTxt: APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING ARE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE FOUNDATION WEBSITE. PLEASE GO TO WWW.KNIGHTFOUNDATION.ORG TO APPLY FOR A GRANT. FOR JOURNALISM, COMMUNITIES, NATIONAL AND ARTS PROGRAMS, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IN OUR ONLINE FORM: TELL US ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY PRESENTED BY YOUR IDEA/PROJECT, WHAT IT WILL TRANSFORM, AND THE IMPACT IT WILL HAVE. HOW WILL IT CREATE LASTING, VISIBLE CHANGE? TELL US HOW YOU INDENTIFIED THIS OPPORTUNITY AND WHY THE TIME IS RIGHT FOR IT. WHAT OTHER PARTNERS OR FUNDERS ARE INVOLVED IN THE IDEA/PROJECT? HOW WILL YOU MEASURE SUCCESS? HOW ARE YOU UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT? PLEASE DESCRIBE ORGANIZATIONAL AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT INCLUDING ANY BUSINESS PLAN. HOW WILL YOUR IDEA/PROJECT BE SUSTAINED BEYOND KNIGHT FOUNDATION'S FUNDING?
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.SubmissionDeadlinesTxt: WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SPECIAL INITIATIVES AND CONTESTS, THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT HAVE DEADLINES.
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.RestrictionsOnAwardsTxt: ANY RESTRICTIONS OR LIMITATIONS ON AWARDS, SUCH AS BY GEOGRAPHICAL AREAS, CHARITABLE FIELDS, KIND OF INSTITUTIONS OR OTHER FACTORS: -MEDICAL RESEARCH, ORGANIZATIONS OR PROJECTS WHOSE MISSION IS TO PREVENT, ERADICATE AND/OR ALLEVIATE THE EFFECTS OF A SPECIFIC DISEASE -POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS AND LEGISLATIVE LOBBYING EFFORTS -PROJECTS THAT EXCLUSIVELY SERVE RELIGIOUS PURPOSES -DIRECT SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS

GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: CERTAIN NEWSPAPERS THAT WERE ONCE OWNED BY KNIGHT RIDDER, INC., A DISQUALIFIED PERSON WITH REGARDS TO THE FOUNDATION, RAN ADVERTISEMENTS FOR THE JOHN S. AND JAMES L. KNIGHT FOUNDATION AT FAIR MARKET VALUE. THE COSTS OF THE ADVERTISEMENTS WERE ALSO INCLUDED IN "OTHER PUBLICATIONS".ADVERTISING EXPENDITURES PROMOTE THE FOUNDATION'S PROGRAMATIC INITIATIVES LIKE THE ART AND NEWS CHALLENGES OR DIRECTLY PROMOTE THE WORK OF GRANTEES.
SEE PART VIII FOR PAYMENTS TO TRUSTEES AND OFFICERS.
DURING THE YEAR, THE FOUNDATION MADE GRANTS OVER WHICH IT EXERCISES EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITIES. SEE STATEMENT 15 FOR A DESCRIPTION OF THESE GRANTS.

KNIGHT FOUNDATION MADE PAYMENTS OF $13.73 MILLION IN 2016 TO COMMUNITY FOUNDATION DONOR ADVISED FUNDS (DAFS) IN ALL 26 COMMUNITIES WHICH ARE TREATED AS QUALIFIED DISTRIBUTIONS. THE FOUNDATION IS THE DONOR ADVISOR FOR THESE DAFS. AS THE ADVISOR ON THE DAFS, KNIGHT MONITORS ALL DISTRIBUTIONS FROM THE DAFS TO ENSURE THAT THEY SUPPORT KNIGHT'S CHARITABLE PURPOSE TO PROMOTE QUALITY JOURNALISM, ADVANCE MEDIA INNOVATION, ENGAGE COMMUNITIES AND FOSTER THE ARTS. SINCE 1998, THE FOUNDATION HAS MADE TOTAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF $154.8 MILLION, INCLUDING 2016, TO ITS DAF PROGRAMS.

GeneralExplanationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990-PF, PART VIII, LIST OF OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND TRUSTEES:
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: THE FULL TIME WORKWEEK HAS BEEN ALLOCATED 40 HOURS. THOSE LISTED ARE EXEMPT POSITIONS WERE EMPLOYEES APPLY NECESSARY HOURS TO PERFORM THEIR JOB.THE TRUSTEES MEET FOUR TIMES A YEAR FOR BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEETINGS WHICH, INCLUDING TRAVEL, REQUIRE A MINIMUM OF TWO DAYS PER SESSION. TRUSTEES TYPICALLY DEVOTE A MINIMUM OF 8 FULL DAYS PER YEAR TO OVERSIGHT AND REVIEW OF THE FOUNDATION'S OPERATIONS PROGRAMS AND INVESTMENTS, THOUGH TYPICALLY MORE.
THE ORGANIZATION ELECTS, UNDER REGULATIONS SECTION 53.4942(A)-3(C)(2), TO APPLY EXCESS DISTRIBUTIONS FROM 2011 TO SATISFY THE DISTRIBUTION REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 170(B)(1)(F) OR 4942(G)(3).
